app.title: App is open in another tab
app.explanation: To avoid duplicate ringing, call collisions, and unexpected behavior, only one active tab is allowed.

takeover.can: You can take control of the app in this tab now.
takeover.cannot: A call is currently active in another tab. You can take over after it ends.

about.information: {app_name} is a full WebRTC client with all of the features you need.

agent_pauses_reason.description: Pause reasons used when an agent pauses a session in queues
agent_pauses_reason.label: Reasons for pauses

rules.name: The name of the reason is required

agent_profiles.default_profile_alert: The default profile cannot be deleted.
agent_profiles.description: Create agent profiles in which you can set reasons for pauses. Profiles can be assigned to user roles

crm_url.description: Configure an endpoint of your CRM to save data from a call.
crm_url.label: CRM URL (optional)

is_global.description: If checked, the profile can be occupied by any of the tenants.
is_global.label: Is global

website_tab.hint: Add a custom tab to the app with an embedded website
website_tab.label: Custom website tab

url.hint: Enter a secure web site (https://) that you can trust. This is important to keep your users safe.
url.label: Web url

contact_control.description: Manage the number of BLF contacts allowed per user to prevent server overload and optimize performance. Set a value between 1 and 100.
contact_control.label: BLF Contact Control

event_logs.info: Viewer of the main events of the application. Available only when the application is installed on the same server as the PBX.

administration.global_setting_hint: This is a global setting and applies to all tenants

delete.content: Are you sure you want to delete this group? All inboxes, conversations and related data will be permanently deleted.

groups.description: With the purpose that the {app_name} users become visible between each other, it is necessary that each user has a group assigned to them, and afterwards, we give access to other users to see this group. This way, you can create multiple groups of users limiting them on which groups they can see. For this, we first create the group name.

errors.groups: The groups could not be loaded
errors.tenants: The tenants could not be loaded

groups.members_disabled_until_save: Create the group to manage members.

rules.name: Group name is required
rules.name_min: Group name must be at least 3 characters

sections.basic_info_hint: Name your group and describe its purpose
sections.members_hint: View and manage members of this group

confirm.content: ⚠️ Warning: Setting the limit above 150 may overload the server and impact performance. For better management, consider organizing users into different groups.
confirm.excessMembers: The new member limit you wish to set is lower than the current member limit. You will have to manually review and delete members to comply with the new limit.

member_limit.description: Manage the number of members allowed per group to avoid server overload and optimize performance.
member_limit.label: Member limit

tooltips.tenant_scope: This group will belong to the selected tenant.

delete.content: Are you sure you want to delete this inbox? All conversations and related data will be permanently removed.

vitalpbx.hint: Configure your SMS provider at: Your PBX installation > PBX/SMS/Messaging Providers

api_key.label: API token
api_key.placeholder: Enter the business account user's access token

business_account_id.label: Business account ID
business_account_id.placeholder: Enter the Business Account ID from the Facebook Developer Dashboard.

phone_number.invalid: Enter a valid phone number starting with a + sign and without any spaces.

phone_number_id.label: Phone number ID
phone_number_id.placeholder: Enter the Phone Number ID from the Facebook Developer Dashboard.

webhook_verification_token.hint: This token is used to verify the authenticity of the Webhook endpoint.
webhook_verification_token.label: Webhook verification token

inboxes.confirm_navigation: You have not completed the setup. Are you sure you want to leave this page?
inboxes.description: The inbox management module allows you to create and manage different inboxes. It facilitates the efficient organization of incoming communications.

auto_assignment_limit.description: Limit the maximum number of conversations from this inbox that can be auto assigned to an agent.
auto_assignment_limit.label: Auto assignment limit

round_robin.hint: Distributes conversations to online agents in a cyclical order.
round_robin.label: Round Robin

self_assignment.hint: Allows agents to assign conversations to themselves.
self_assignment.label: Agent Self-Assignment

enable_channel_greeting.description: Automatically send greeting messages to customers as soon as they initiate a conversation and send their initial message.
enable_channel_greeting.label: Enable channel greeting

greeting_message.label: Greeting message
greeting_message.placeholder: Hello! Thank you for contacting us. You will be attended to shortly by one of our agents.

group.hint: Select the group to which the Inbox will belong.

sms.hint: Copy the URL and paste it into the 'Event Notification URL' field in the configuration of the selected number provider: Your PBX installation > PBX/SMS/Messaging Providers.

whatsapp.hint: Configure the Webhook in Facebook Developer App.

setup_instructions.label: Setup instructions
setup_instructions.short_description: Your inbox is set up and ready to use! Start managing your messages and conversations with ease.
setup_instructions.title: Your inbox is set up and ready to use!

presence.description: Here, the system administrator can create the different presence status that users can use. By default, there are five (5) status which are, Available, Do Not Disturb, Lunch Break, and Business Trip, however, you can add more.

info.default_status: Default statuses cannot be edited or deleted.

agent_profile.hint: Assign an agent profile to be used in case the assigned role has call center permissions.

role_manager.description: edit or create custom roles and assign permissions according to the roles that users will perform.

call-center-features.description: Call center features such as login and logout in queues are enabled.
call-center-features.label: Call center features

queue-selection.description: When this option is checked, the agent will be able to select the queue(s) they will log into. If unselected, they will log into all the queues they belong to.
queue-selection.label: Queue selection

agent-profiles.description: Check this option if you want to allow access to the agent profiles module
agent-profiles.label: Agent profiles

events-log.description: Permission to access the event viewer of the application (available only when the app is installed on the same server as the PBX).
events-log.label: Event logs

groups.description: Check this option if you want to allow access to the groups module.
groups.label: Groups

inboxes.description: Check this option if you want to allow access to the inboxes module.
inboxes.label: Inboxes

roles.description: Check this option if you want to allow access to the roles module.
roles.label: Roles

users.description: Check this option if you want to allow access to the users module.
users.label: Users

chat.description: Users will be able to send and receive messages to and from other group members.
chat.label: Chat

conversation-assignment.description: This permission grants the ability to assign conversations from inboxes to other agents.
conversation-assignment.label: Conversation assignment

update_social_networks.description: Permission to configure the social networks that will appear in the footer.
update_social_networks.label: Update social networks

view-recordings.description: The user will be able to see their call recordings generated by the PBX
view-recordings.label: View recordings

social_networks.description: Here, you can configure the social media that will appear on the footer.

pbx_settings.description: Set up relevant data to connect to your PBX. This information is necessary to register the extensions from its users, voicemail, call history, among other characteristics.

key.hint: You can create keys in your PBX: Admin/Admin/Application Keys

pjsip_port.hint: Configure the port to be used for extension registration

wss_port.hint: If you have a firewall, don't forget to allow TCP port through so your client can connect.

2fa.title: Two-Factor Authentication
2fa.description: Enable an extra layer of security for your account by requiring a code from your mobile authenticator app.
2fa.hint: Scan the QR code using an authenticator app (e.g. Google Authenticator or Microsoft Authenticator).
2fa.warning_not_verified: Two-factor authentication is not yet confirmed. Please complete verification to activate it.
2fa.or_enter_key: Or manually enter this secret key:
2fa.secret_description: You can manually enter this key into your authenticator app instead of scanning the QR code.
2fa.snackbar_verified: 2FA is now fully enabled and will be required next login.
2fa.recovery_code_hint: If you lose your mobile device or security key, you can generate a recovery code to sign in to your account.
2fa.recovery_code_instruction: You should store the recovery code securely. It can help you access your account if needed.
2fa.recovery_code_warning: Save this code securely. It will not be shown again.
2fa.error: Something went wrong while updating your 2FA status.
